text: Albert Giger (7 October 1946 – 4 September 2021) was a Swiss cross country skier. He competed in the early 1970s. He won a bronze medal at the 1972 Winter Olympics in Sapporo. He was as well a 5-times winner of the Engadin Skimarathon. Giger died on 4 September 2021 at the age of 74.Albert Giger, l'un des héros de Sapporo 1972, est décédé ==References== ==Other websites== * Max Bardone Fan Club on the 1972 4 x 10km bronze (Switzerland) Category:1946 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Olympic bronze medalists for Switzerland Category:Swiss skiers Category:People from Graubünden
title: Albert Giger
